### isExactlyValue() {#a95b3f9929e9afa127860ac01630e7387}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::ConstantFPSDNode::isExactlyValue (double V) const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
We don&#39;t rely on operator== working on double values, as it returns true for things that are clearly not equal, like -0.0 and 0.0.

As such, this method can be used to do an exact bit-for-bit comparison of two floating point values. We leave the version with the double argument here because it&#39;s just so convenient to write &quot;2.0&quot; and the like. Without this function we&#39;d have to duplicate its logic everywhere it&#39;s called.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagnodes-h/#l01775">1775</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagnodes-h">SelectionDAGNodes.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isExactlyValue() {#aa9482fcae0e63e3a49586bcb659824a1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ConstantFPSDNode::isExactlyValue (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfloat">APFloat</a> &amp; V) const</>}>
isExactlyValue - We don&#39;t rely on operator== working on double values, as it returns true for things that are clearly not equal, like -0.0 and 0.0.

As such, this method can be used to do an exact bit-for-bit comparison of two floating point values.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagnodes-h/#l01778">1778</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagnodes-h">SelectionDAGNodes.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/selectiondag-cpp/#l00133">133</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/selectiondag-cpp">SelectionDAG.cpp</a>.
